review_title: Great place to work, beautiful place to live!
job_title: Decision Support Lead in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Skagit Valley is a beautiful location and there are wonderful people who live and work here! The organization is doing some very cutting edge things and has positioned itself as the healthcare leader in the county.
cons: Because of our count demographics, salaries are on the lower side.

pros: Wonderful hospital staff (drs, rns, etc) Great French fries Smaller hospital

pros: I enjoy the team I work with and the organization! My supervisor is also amazing!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Team oriented Unit manager support

job_title: RN Float Pool in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Good benefits, they are flexible with scheduling, opportunities for advancement in your nursing career are available, good MOU for picking up shifts.
cons: Pay is subpar, there's nowhere near enough parking available for staff.

job_title: Per Diem RN in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Flexibility of schedule working per diem. Pay in leu on benefits.
cons: High stressed environment with high stressed Staff. High turnover of staff leading to short staffing.

review_title: It’s a good step towards getting experience
job_title: Clinical Specialist in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Flexible schedule, great co-workers, great medical benefits
cons: Upper management is only focused on their own pay and not the people actually working in the hospital. Cut open positions to “save money” and put more work on current employees without raise increase or bonuses etc.

job_title: Medical Assistant in Mount Vernon, WA
pros:
Guaranteed raises (unionized).
Effective communication regarding upcoming changes, updates on the financial status within the organization, etc.
cons:
Staffing issues related to hiring (not just this organization).
Staffing issues related to delegation of resources and allowing healthcare workers to work at the top of their scope. For example, making PA-Cs and ARNPs run the stress test labs in hospitals instead of a RN is a waste of resources. It is within their scope of practice and they can be trained on the job. This would not only allow ARNPs and PA-Cs to help see patients in our clinics and prevent unnecessary hospitalizations due to effective preventative care, but it would also be more cost-effective (for patients, and also for the hospital).

job_title: Coding Supervisor in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Pay is good and there are some great people working at SRH.
cons: Some management is not respectful or helpful at all. Not responsive most times so when questions need to be answered that does not get done in a timely manner.

job_title: ARNP in Bellingham, WA
pros: Pays double what most organizations pay along the I-5 corrtidor
cons: Poor management with lack of vision Culture of fear

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Most staff is dedicated and caring
cons: Hard to have patient-centered care in today's health care environment

job_title: Customer Service Supervisor in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Patients make your day everyday
cons: Management staff is beyond horrible.

job_title: Medical Receptionist II in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Great management and co-workers along with work environment.
cons: The company is not focused on employees but is focused on money.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: They are union positions therefore the pay is fair across the board.
cons: Pay is not competitive for the current market.

job_title: Customer Service Professional (CSP) in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Nice co workers and benefits
cons: Does not care if you have absences due to medical conditions, will still fire you and then you are not rehireable

job_title: Registered Nurse MSN in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Great retirement plan, wonderful coworkers committed to caring for the community they serve.
cons:
Top heavy company, too many Administrators, VPs, mid level managers, constantly changing the game plan, too busy being reactive rather than proactive. Trying too hard to become bigger, instead of better. Admin has Security walk around giving "parking tickets" because we cannot find parking since 2007 when the new hospital was built. The neighborhoods are packed with employee and patients parking on the street. STAFFING IS AWFUL. 
Safety is the #1 Service Standard but there are no tools to achieve this goal.

job_title: CNA in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Good place to work. Nice employees.
cons: Cafe not open at night

review_title: Poor communication with management, lack of teamwork
job_title: Registered Nurse in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: The CNAs are extremely hard workers and always willing to help and go above and beyond for patients needs and maintaining safety. CNAs have great attitudes, overnight staff much more pleasant day shift nurses.
cons: Some nurses and providers are so snobby. Manager did not want to confront any issues or discuss challenges. Lack of teamwork. Amongst staff, some nurses offer help but if you take them up on their offer they are too busy sitting around to help. Alot of 'thats not my patient' going on so you almost didn't want to take an official break because you'd have a list of things to do upon returning.

job_title: Medical Technologist in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Work is interesting and fast paced.
cons: Management....and mostly its traveling tech working there. The turnover is very high. There are more managers than workers and they are new and lack experience. Its pretty chaotic.

review_title: Do Not Come to Skagit Regional Clinics
job_title: Medical Assistant in Smokey Point, WA
pros: There is a better insurance plan than others at Skagit
cons: - no support from management when I was fighting with an MA who fought with 3 other coworkers. Manager then intimidated me out, placed me on administrative leave when I put my notice in and when I tried to file a complaint with HR I was literally ignored and never responded to.

job_title: Registered Phlebotomy Technician in Mount Vernon, WA

job_title: Radiology Technologist in Bellingham, WA
pros: Small hospital and friendly staff

job_title: Staff RN in Mount Vernon, WA

Very supportive environment, great inpt Nephro and Infectious Dz rotations, others are strong as well. Very diverse patients and colleagues.

Limited sub specialty exposures, not many procedural specialties take or like taking residents for Is balanced npby some of our excellent inpt specialty rotations.

job_title: Registered Polysomnography Technologist in Mount Vernon, WA

cons: With the global pandemic, we are all having to adapt how we do business. We recently had to comply with our governor's order for mandatory vaccines for healthcare workers. Not everyone is happy, but I believe our management team handled it very well.

pros: People who care about others work here.

review_title: Caring, but overworked and under appreciated

job_title: Phlebotomist in Mount Vernon, WA

Caring executives and management team.

review_title: Great community hospital to work for

cons: some union rules are more challenging to work with than others. In my current position I cannot take an hour lunch with my bosses approval due to union laws.

job_title: Accounting Clerk in Bellingham, WA

review_title: A good place to gain some experience

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Mount Vernon, WA

cons: none for myself personally so far, but from what i’ve heard maternity leave is only about 6 weeks and they use your PTO for holidays/low census days

cons: Depending on what department you work in, some managers are not very well at managing their departments.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Mount Vernon, WA

job_title: Patient Registration in Mount Vernon, WA

Benefits

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Mount Vernon, WA

cons: The company doesnt care about you. The managers really dont care, and they make that very clear. We never got breaks or lunches, and during the busy weekends you work alone. There were times that I coudnt even get a bathroom break.

job_title: Certified Coding Specialist in Mount Vernon, WA

job_title: Staff Pharmacist in Mount Vernon, WA

Great Pay

cons:

job_title: Analyst in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Many opportunities for growth within the company. I love working for SRH
cons: Lower wages compared to many places in the region

job_title: Registered Nurse in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: I have worked at SVH for about 10 years and it is just an ok place to work, not great but ok.  The nursing staff and kind and supportive of each other, the facility is reasonably new, and and the patient care has its own rewards.  I continue to work at SVH for several reasons, one is the I can walk to work and the pay is good.  The best matching 401k I have ever seen.
cons: There are so many minor irritations to my employment at SVH they are difficult to list.  A lack of commitment to any staff education, no in-house education, no repayment for conferences, very limited education reimbursement for degree programs.  Frequent leadership turnover within middle management, and the associated changes that come with a new leader.  A culture that like to lay blame, before determining a problems cause.  An overwhelming and frequently oppressive sense to save a buck frequently at the expense of patients and staff.  Little respect for front line bedside staff and there working conditions.  Frequent small changes to many processes that individually are inconsequential but together are significant and create a hectic and potentially unsafe work environment.

review_title: Bleed you to death, If I could give zero rating I would
job_title: Clinical Staff in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: You are worked to death far beyond your scope of practice, because of this you learn far more then you are qualified or paid to.
cons: If you like to be grossly underpaid compared to industry standards , over worked with no breaks and then not get paid for over-time because it's not what your current schedule is, managed by 25 year old daughters of the CFO with no experience, have a time-clock system that "rounds up" your clock-in time and basically steals from you, have no vacation approved because your department is short staffed, and enter all orders for the providers so they can get a 30% bonus by meeting meaningful use and you get zero, deal with totally unprofessional people that harass you and HR does NOTHING on a daily basis and be forced to work waaaay beyond your scope of practice, then by all means Skagit Regional Health is the place for you.

review_title: Overall I enjoyed my years there
job_title: Desktop Publisher/Print Shop in Mount Vernon, WA
pros:
Family like environment
Great co-workers (mostly)
Fast pace
I was allowed a flexible schedule
Recognition awards, (I think they stopped doing this tho). 
Kitchen / Cafeteria has a healthy menu
Onsite Gym for $5 /month
They do lot's of outreach programs (charity and fundraising)
Several company banquets annually
Several sponsored medical programs free or super cheap annually
Residency program
Great benefits package
Onsite providers equals easy access
cons:
Parking can be difficult
HR leadership is for the organization and NOT the employee 
My last Director allowed me to be bullied by another employee

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: They have a wonderful Emergency Department with super doctors and nurses!  If you have a heart attack or stroke it is the place you wanna be!  State of the art radiology department and a great place to work!
cons: The hospital does not do well suring high patient volumes especially when there are no beds left to admit patients to.  It's not that they don't always have the room it is frequently due to low staffing.  There has been a lot of turnover with doctors and nurses.  I feel that is because they focus too much on profit and not enough on gods patient care.  They over work their staff with minimum rewards so there is a high turn over rate.  Very unfortunate!

job_title: Women's Health Nurse Practitioner in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Decent pay for Skagit County and opportunity to work on production if that's attractive. Physical facility up-to-date. I was given 90 days pay at severance.
cons: Poor communication by Administration with me. My position was eliminated after one year.  The position was new but I wasn't told that it was temporary or subject to elimination. I wasn't given the chance to increase my production or transfer to another department.  Morale among many coworkers was terrible, lived in fear of management and then apathetic.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: There are a number of good people that work for the hospital, the benefits are fairly good, other than the cost of health care (go figure), and the pay is very good for Skagit County.
cons: Terrible administration; the acquisition of Skagit Regional Clinics was a disaster; along with the good people, there are a number that have no clue how to do their job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Great work culture.   People seem invested in their jobs and the patients they serve.  They seem to be growing and making improvements.
cons:
Lower than average pay.
Worst benefits I have ever seen.   Individual health insurance is free but if you have a family it is way too expensive,  it's like paying COBRA prices.    Employer paid 401k doesn't start  until you've been there 2.5 years and even then their contribution amount is poor.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: I have worked at Skagit Valley Hospital for over 25 years. This has been an excellent place to work with lots of opportunity for advancement and to learn new skills. My salary is very fair and the benefits are excellent. The people I work with are supportive, the culture of the organization promotes positive interactions with co-workers, visitors and patients The facilities are beautiful and well maintained. Highly recommend!
cons: I do not have any cons at this time.

job_title: CNA in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Great team of nurses, doctors and support staff.
cons: Poor employee morale housewide due to the administrations bullying tactics towards employees who openly voice problems or concerns. Nepotism at CEO level monopolizes control of the whole Skagit Regional Clinic entity.

review_title: I would return to work here.

review_title: Overall a pleasant place to work
